page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT IN BERE FERRERS.
page.content: From a fascinating past,when Bere Ferrers Parish employed local men and those impressed from Derbyshire mines in its highly productive silver and lead mining industry,Bere Ferrers has now become the place of which the local hotel proprietress said,"To stay here you've got to be self-employed - that includes farm labourers".The farm labourers are now contract farmworkers -the farms being mainly family run . Horticulture,which used to be a wholesale market stopped because labour was scarce and the railway freight service was discontinued.The early morning train carries employees and other commuters to Plymouth.The repair garage is family run.Other self-employed people are a builder, picture framer, market seller and potter.There is also a hairdresser and a barber.
